{"step_by_step_thinking": "Relative bradycardia refers to a condition where the heart rate is lower than expected given the severity of the illness. It is commonly seen in certain infections. Brucellosis, typhoid, and malaria are all known to cause relative bradycardia. Factitious fever, on the other hand, is a condition where an individual intentionally feigns or exaggerates symptoms of fever. It is not typically associated with relative bradycardia. Therefore, the correct answer is D. Factitious fever.", "answer_choice": "D"}
